ravensproject

Class RavensProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ravensproject.RavensProblem

  • public class RavensProblem
extends java.lang.Object
    A single Raven's Progressive Matrix problem, represented by a type (2x2 or or 3x3), a String name, and a HashMap of figures. Information is also given regarding whether visual or verbal representations are provided for the problem.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RavensProblem(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String problemType, java.lang.String problemSetName, boolean hasVisual, boolean hasVerbal)
      Initializes a new Raven's Progressive Matrix problem given a name, a type, and a correct answer to the problem.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Returns the HashMap representing the RavensFigures of the problem.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this problem.
      java.lang.String getProblemType()
      Returns the type of problem: 2x2 or 3x3.
      boolean hasVerbal()
      Returns whether a verbal representation is supplied for this problem.

      Returns whether a visual representation is supplied for this problem.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RavensProblem

        public RavensProblem(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String problemType,
             java.lang.String problemSetName,
             boolean hasVisual,
             boolean hasVerbal)
        Initializes a new Raven's Progressive Matrix problem given a name, a type, and a correct answer to the problem. Also initializes a blank HashMap representing the figures in the problem. Your agent does not need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the problem, typically a number
        problemType - the type of problem: 2x1, 2x2, or 3x3

    • Method Detail

      • getProblemType

        public java.lang.String getProblemType()
        Returns the type of problem: 2x2 or 3x3. 2x2 problems have 6 answer choices; 3x3 problems have 8 answer choices.
        Returns:
        a String of the problem type: "2x2" or "3x3".

      • getFigures

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,RavensFigure> getFigures()
        Returns the HashMap representing the RavensFigures of the problem. The key for each figure is the name of the figure. For example: getFigures().get("A") would return the first frame in a problem. getFigures().get("3") would return the third answer choice in a problem. getFigures().get("G") would return the third row, first column of a 3x3 problem. The value for each key is the RavensFigure corresponding to that figure of the problem. In 2x2, the figures are named A, B, and C. A is to B as C is to one of the answer choices. Similarly, A is to C as B is to one of the answer choices. In 2x2 problems, relationships are present both across the rows and down the columns. The answer choices are named 1 through 6. In 3x3, the figures in the first row are named from left to right A, B, and C. The figures in the second row are named from left to right D, E, and F. The figures in the third row are named from left to right G and H. Relationships are present across rows and down columns: A is to B is to C as D is to E is to F as G is to H is to one of the answer choices. A is to D is G as B is to E is to H as C is to F is to one of the answer choices. The answer choices are named 1 through 8.
        Returns:
        a HashMap of the RavensFigures in this problem

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this problem. Your agent does not need to use this method.
        Returns:
        the name of the problem

      • hasVerbal

        public boolean hasVerbal()
        Returns whether a verbal representation is supplied for this problem. If this problem has no verbal representation, then the HashMap of RavensObject in RavensFigure will be empty. Your agent may need to use this method.
        Returns:
        true if a verbal representation is available; false if not.

      • hasVisual

        public boolean hasVisual()
        Returns whether a visual representation is supplied for this problem. Your agent may need to use this method.
        Returns:
        true if a verbal representation is available; false if not.
